texto: The basic structural configuration of the depressed Managed Lanes consists of a six-lane facility with narrow median, four-foot inside shoulders and 10-foot outside shoulders. The depressed Managed Lanes are excavated between retaining walls.
Approximately half the width of the General Purpose Lanes is on a bridge overhang over the depressed Managed Lanes, supported by straddle bents across the whole width of the Managed Lanes.
Pavement design has been developed using AASHTO design procedures, taking into account the different subgrade geologies present beneath the Managed Lanes, General Purpose Lanes and Frontage Roads.
The fact that the new Managed Lanes must be built within the existing facility poses challenges in terms of traffic maintenance; this has required an extraordinary effort of planning and design.
